question_sentence: The most powerful rocket ever built was launched this week – but its flight ended in a dramatic mid-air explosion. What was the rocket’s name?
evidence: SpaceX’s Starship, the most powerful rocket ever built, took off from a launch pad in South Texas on Thursday morning. However, the rocket exploded less than three minutes into its first test flight.

question_sentence: Several powerful tornadoes struck the US this week, leaving thousands without power and some trapped inside shelters. Which state appeared to be the hardest hit?
evidence: The storms were reported across Oklahoma, Kansas and Iowa, with the most damage reported in Oklahoma, according to officials. At least four confirmed tornadoes moved across the state and knocked out power for about 20,000 homes and businesses.

question_sentence: How many potential UFO cases is the US government currently tracking?
evidence: The US government is tracking more than 650 potential UFO cases, according to the Pentagon. Despite continued speculation, officials reiterated this week that there’s no evidence of extraterrestrial life in the sightings.

question_sentence: The CDC updated its recommendations on Covid-19 vaccines to allow another booster dose for people in which age group?
evidence: People who are 65 and older or those who have weakened immune systems and “want the option of added protection” are now allowed another booster dose, the CDC said this week.

question_sentence: Which social media platform said its users can now apply to receive a share of a $725 million settlement?
evidence: Facebook users who had an active account between May 2007 and December 2022 can now apply for a share of the company’s $725 million settlement reached in a major data privacy scandal.

question_sentence: Panic buying caused widespread gas station closures in which state this week?
evidence: More than half of the gas stations in the Miami-Fort Lauderdale area were without gasoline Wednesday after flooding from last week’s massive storm caused a wave of panic buying by drivers topping off their tanks.

question_sentence: Which small intruder crawled through a fence at the White House this week, prompting a swift response from the US Secret Service?
evidence: A toddler infiltrated White House grounds, setting off security alerts. The young boy was caught by officers before being quickly reunited with his parents.

question_sentence: Which news organization this week agreed to the largest publicly known defamation settlement in US history?
evidence: Fox News will pay more than $787 million to Dominion Voting Systems after the two sides agreed to a last-minute settlement Tuesday in the explosive defamation case brought against the right-wing network.

question_sentence: About 1 in 4 people in the US live with air pollution that can hurt their health, according to a new report. Which region has the most ozone-polluted cities?
evidence: Residents of Western cities are disproportionately affected, according to a new report from the American Lung Association. California had 10 of the 25 most ozone-polluted cities. New York, Chicago and Hartford, Connecticut, were the only three on the list east of the Mississippi River.

question_sentence: Which fast-food chain is upgrading its signature burgers?
evidence: McDonald’s, which has been focusing on upgrading its core items to boost sales, is rolling out a series of changes to improve its classic burgers.

question_sentence: Which quarterback agreed this week to a five-year, $255 million deal, making them the highest paid player in NFL history?
Almost $450 million worth of which item was found floating off the coast of Italy?
Fans of which show voiced their displeasure after Netflix was unable to air its reunion special live?
Cell phones blared to life at 4:45 a.m. ET in Florida with an emergency alert detailing:
choices: A test of the alert system

question_sentence: According to reports, which MLB team signed a binding purchase agreement for 49 acres of land near the Las Vegas Strip?
Dominion Voting Systems settled with which TV network in a defamation lawsuit over the broadcast of lies after the 2020 presidential election?
Which Supreme Court justice – already in hot water over gifts from a donor – was found to have claimed income from a defunct real estate firm?
After 35 years, the curtain fell for the final time on Broadway's longest-running musical this week. What is the show called?
Which state's board of education voted to ban teaching about sexual orientation and gender identity from kindergarten through 12th grade?
What is the name of SpaceX's rocket, which exploded shortly after lifting off on its first test flight this week?
Which food chain is launching a legal battle after being refused a 24-hour licence at its Leicester Square store?
evidence: The British bakery chain is set for a courtroom showdown with Westminster Council after being denied permission  to sell hot food at its flagship London outlet after 11pm..The application was rejected last year after police warned that selling late-night sausage rolls risked fuelling “crime and disorder”.

question_sentence: The president of which South American country has been invited to visit Ukraine to “understand the real causes and essence of Russian aggression”?
evidence: Ukraine’s government invited Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva to visit after he caused consternation among Kyiv’s Western allies by urging the US to “stop encouraging the war” there and calling for a peace deal with Russia.

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak has faced scrutiny as a subject of how many investigations or probes in the past year?
evidence: The prime minister is under investigation by Parliament’s sleaze watchdog over allegations of a possible failure to declare shares held by his wife in a childcare agency boosted by the recent Budget. Sunak has also faced scrutiny over issues including his wife’s non-dom tax status, his US green card and his dog-walking habits.

question_sentence: Why did German artist Boris Eldagsen refuse to accept a Sony World Photography Award for his image Pseudomnesia: The Electrician?
choices: He thought rival entries were better
It was generated by artificial intelligence
The judges included his former partner
evidence: Eldagsen explained on his website that he submitted the black-and-white image “as a cheeky monkey, to find out if the competitions are prepared for AI images to enter”. He concluded: “They are not.”

question_sentence: The quiche chosen to be the signature dish for King Charles’s coronation features which of the following ingredients?
evidence: The coronation quiche was chosen by the King and Queen Consort as the suggested centrepiece for big lunches, street parties and other community events on 6 May. Royal head chef Mark Flanagan came up with the recipe.

question_sentence: Which social media platform expanded its link-sharing feature this week?
evidence: Mark Zuckerberg announced that Instagram users will now be able to share up to five links in their profile “bio”. Previously, only one link to external websites was allowed. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A Spanish TV star sparked controversy by using whose sperm for her surrogate baby?
evidence: Ana Obregón has been the focus of public debate since having a baby girl via surrogacy (which is illegal in Spain) in the US, using the sperm of her son Alessio, who died of cancer in 2020 at the age of 27. The 68-year-old TV presenter told Hola! that her son’s “dying wish” was to have a child, so the baby “isn’t my daughter, but my granddaughter”.

question_sentence: The Italian town of Portofino is banning tourists from doing what?
choices: Taking alcoholic drinks into the sea
evidence: The Italian Riviera town is introducing fines of up to €275 for loitering in designated no-waiting zones, in a bid to prevent street blockages caused by tourists taking snaps and selfies.

question_sentence: Fox News agreed to pay electronic voting company Dominion how much to settle a defamation lawsuit?
evidence: Fox News avoided a high-profile defamation trial by reaching the last-minute deal with Dominion, concluding two years of litigation over the news network’s airing of false claims that the 2020 US presidential election was rigged.

question_sentence: Just Stop Oil activists disrupted play at which sports tournament on Monday?
evidence: Play was disrupted after a protester climbed onto a table and covered it with orange powder, while another activist tried to glue herself to a different table. The duo were arrested following the invasion at Sheffield’s Crucible.
